channel.title: Looking for Team - Standard Requirements
channel.description:
I'm wanting to find team members to build multiple types of applications from simple resource programs to multiplayer games. I would like to have an eclectic team of people, so finding this team shouldn't be that hard on these forums....:rolleyes: Most applications we make would be cross-platform and accessible on Android and iOS.
[size=11pt][i]Any client made will be written in Java. Servers for multiplayer games can be written in C# or Java.[/i][/size]
[hr] [center]Creating a secure team means secure requirements[/center] [hr]
[center][size=14pt]Requirements[/size][/center]
1. Getting familiar with some of these libraries is going to be a [b]MUST[/b]
[ul][li][url=http://www.lwjgl.org/]LWJGL[/url][/li] [li][url=http://www.robovm.com/]RoboVM[/url][/li] [li][url=https://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html?hl=i]Android SDK[/url][/li] [li][url=http://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/]LibGDX[/url][/li] [li][url=http://netty.io/]Netty (preferrably Netty 5)[/url][/li][/ul]
2. Standard Knowledge over [b]at least one of these languages[/b]; completing a set of instructions on designing a system would not be a problem.
[ul][li]Java - This languages is class-based and object-oriented supported by multiple platforms like Android, Windows, and Mac OS X.[/li] [li]C# - This language is multi-paradigm combining principles from C and C++ with a general purpose to develop software for Microsoft[/li] [li]Python - This language is pretty easy to use (especially for plugin systems) and shortens programming time along with lines[/li] [li]Ruby - This language can be quite similar to Python, with some obvious major differences and is also easy to use and shortens programming time and lines[/li] [li]PHP - This language is used mostly for building websites.[/li][/ul]
3. Use of any of the following Git Version Control Systems should be easy
[ul][li][url=https://github.com/]GitHub[/url][/li] [li][url=https://bitbucket.org/]BitBucket[/url][/li][/ul]
4. Proof of work by using the method below
[ul][li]Live Coding Samples via Skype for an instructional session + questions[/li][/ul]
Use this format to apply for a programming spot on the team. You can post below or private message me. [code] Name (First and Last): Age: Skype Name: Programming Language(s): [/code]
[hr] The Team:
[ul][li][url=https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile]Wildskiller[/url][/li] [li][url=http://www.rune-server.org/members/squidward/]Squidward[/url][/li][/ul]

item.title: Looking for Team - Standard Requirements
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

I’m wanting to find team members to build multiple types of applications from simple resource programs to multiplayer games. I would like to have an eclectic team of people, so finding this team shouldn’t be that hard on these forums…:rolleyes: Most applications we make would be cross-platform and accessible on Android and iOS.

[size=11pt]Any client made will be written in Java. Servers for multiplayer games can be written in C# or Java.[/size]

[hr]
[center]Creating a secure team means secure requirements[/center]
[hr]

[center][size=14pt]Requirements[/size][/center]

  1. Getting familiar with some of these libraries is going to be a MUST

[ul][li]LWJGL[/li]
[li]RoboVM[/li]
[li]Android SDK[/li]
[li]LibGDX[/li]
[li]Netty (preferrably Netty 5)[/li][/ul]

  1. Standard Knowledge over at least one of these languages; completing a set of instructions on designing a system would not be a problem.

[ul][li]Java - This languages is class-based and object-oriented supported by multiple platforms like Android, Windows, and Mac OS X.[/li]
[li]C# - This language is multi-paradigm combining principles from C and C++ with a general purpose to develop software for Microsoft[/li]
[li]Python - This language is pretty easy to use (especially for plugin systems) and shortens programming time along with lines[/li]
[li]Ruby - This language can be quite similar to Python, with some obvious major differences and is also easy to use and shortens programming time and lines[/li]
[li]PHP - This language is used mostly for building websites.[/li][/ul]

  1. Use of any of the following Git Version Control Systems should be easy

[ul][li]GitHub[/li]
[li]BitBucket[/li][/ul]

  1. Proof of work by using the method below

[ul][li]Live Coding Samples via Skype for an instructional session + questions[/li][/ul]

Use this format to apply for a programming spot on the team. You can post below or private message me.

Name (First and Last):
Age:
Skype Name:
Programming Language(s):

[hr]
The Team:

[ul][li]Wildskiller[/li]
[li]Squidward[/li][/ul]
